definition: Prose based on facts, real events, and real people, including memoir, essay, journalism, and academic writing

positive_examples: Creative nonfiction uses literary techniques while maintaining factual accuracy.
Nonfiction genres: memoir, biography, essay, journalism, history, self-help.
Narrative nonfiction tells true stories with the craft of fiction.
The nonfiction writer is bound by what actually happened.
training_hints.disambiguation: Factual prose as a literary category with its own craft, not just truth-telling
